section.title: Description
section.p: Positron emission tomography: PET. A highly specialized imaging technique that uses short-lived radioactive substances to produce three-dimensional colored images of those substances functioning within the body. These images are called PET scans and the technique is termed PET scanning. [Source: Medical Dictionary - MedicineNet.com]

stentry.p: The date of the diagnostic test PET SCAN.
Indicates the results of the diagnostic test PET SCAN. Possoble values are Not done; Positive; Negative; Unknown/not documented; etc.
